et: borrowed from Middle French {it}emboscade, embuscade,{/it} borrowed from Italian {it}imboscata,{/it} from {it}imboscare{/it} "to hide in a forest or behind vegetation" (from {it}im-{/it} {et_link|im-|in-:2} + {it}-boscare,{/it} derivative of {it}bosco{/it} "forest," going back —perhaps via Langobardic— to Germanic {it}*boska-/*buska-{/it} "bush, thicket") + {it}-ata,{/it} suffix of action and result {ma}{mat|bush:1|}, {mat|-ade|}{/ma}
For the initial {it}am-{/it} in place of {it}em-{/it} see note at {et_link|ambush:1|ambush:1}.
